title: The Personal Health Questionnaire: a new screening instrument for detection of ICD-10 depressive disorders in primary care
abstract: The PHQ can be strongly suggested as an accurate and economic screener to identify primary care attenders at high risk of being clinically depressed. However, in order to identify patients requiring antidepressant drug treatment, a second-phase assessment of PHQ high scorers (total score of > or = 10), using the HDRS, is needed.
